Kapolri Komitmen Ungkap Pelaku Teror Pimpinan KPK dan Novel Baswedan
04 Nov 2019, 15:03 by Eko Sulestyono



Kapolri Komitmen Ungkap Pelaku Teror Pimpinan KPK dan Novel Baswedan



Kapolri Komitmen Ungkap Pelaku Teror Pimpinan KPK dan Novel Baswedan


KBRN, Jakarta : Pimpinan Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) siang ini menerima kunjungan Kapolri Jenderal Polisi Idham Azis di Gedung KPK Merah Putih, Jalan Kuningan Persada, Kuningan, Jakarta Selatan. Usai melakukan pertemuan secara tertutup, Ketua KPK Agus Rahardjo dan Kapolri Idham Aziz langsung menggelar acara jumpa pers di Gedung KPK Jakarta.
Kepada wartawan, Idham Aziz menegaskan terkait komitmen Polri yang bertekad akan mengungkap kasus-kasus teror yang ditujukan kepada Pimpinan maupun pegawai KPK. Salah satunya adalah kasus teror yang menimpa Novel Baswedan, penyidik senior KPK.
Menurut Idham Aziz, dalam waktu dekat dirinya akan melantik Kabareskrim yang baru. Idaman menjelaskan diharapkan dengan Kabareskrum yang baru Itu akan mampu mempercepat penanganan atau pengungkapan kasus-kasus  teror, salah satunya yang menimpa Novel. 
"Saya tetap berkomitmen seperti di fit and proper test, di paripurna. Secepatnya nanti saya akan memilih Kabaresk, namun di dalam Polri khan ada Wanjakti (Dewan Jabatan dan Kepangkatan Tinggi) yang dipimpin Wakapolri, tentu kita akan cari perwira terbaik sehingga secepatnya kasus itu diungkap, begitu juga dengan kasus lainnya” kata Idham Azis di Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).
Kepala Divisi Hubungan Masyarakat (Kadivhumas) Polri Irjen Polisi M Iqbal menegaskan lagi terkait perkembangan soal temuan signifikan yang disampaikan Tim Teknis. Namun menurut M. Iqbal hasil temuan itu belum bisa diungkap kepada publik, dirinya beralasan karena dikhawatirkan malah akan mempersulit dalam upaya lanjutan terkait pengungkapan kasus teror terhadap Novel Baswedan.
"Saya juga sampaikan ada temuan-temuan yang sangat signifikan yang sudah didapatkan oleh tim teknis pencari fakta” jelasnya.
Menurut Iqbal, tim teknis bekerja sangat tertutup berbeda dengan tim pencari fakta terbuka. Tim teknis) kita melakukan teknis kepolisian, oleh karena itu hingga saat ini kita masih belum buka (temuan) itu kepada publik.
“Kita bisa saja kembali ke nol .Insyaallah tidak akan berapa lama lagi kita mengungkap kasus ini, tim teknis bekerja sangat maksimal, detik demi detik, ini masalah waktu saja doakan segera terang benderang," pungkas M.Iqbal.

National Police Chief Commits to Revealing the Terror Actors of the KPK Leaders and Baswedan Novels
04 Nov 2019, 15:03 by Eko Sulestyono



National Police Chief Commits to Revealing the Terror Actors of the KPK Leaders and Baswedan Novels



National Police Chief Commits to Revealing the Terror Actors of the KPK Leaders and Baswedan Novels


KBRN, Jakarta: The leadership of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) this afternoon received a visit from the National Police Chief, General Idham Azis, at the KPK Gedung Merah Putih, Jalan Kuningan Persada, Kuningan, South Jakarta. After a closed meeting, KPK Chairman Agus Rahardjo and National Police Chief Idham Aziz immediately held a press conference at the Jakarta KPK Building.
To reporters, Idham Aziz emphasized the commitment of the National Police which was determined to uncover terror cases aimed at KPK leaders and employees. One of them was a terror case that struck Novel Baswedan, a KPK senior investigator.
According to Idham Aziz, in the near future he will inaugurate the new Kabareskrim. Idaman explained that it was hoped that the new Kabareskrum would be able to speed up the handling or disclosure of terror cases, one of which befell Novel.
"I remain committed as in the fit and proper test, in the plenary session. As soon as I will choose Kabaresk as soon as possible, but within the National Police there is a Wanjakti (Board of Position and Higher Office) led by the Deputy Chief of Police, of course we will look for the best officers as soon as the case is revealed "So is the case with other cases," Idham Azis said in Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
Head of the Public Relations Division (Kadivhumas) National Police Inspector General of Police M Iqbal reiterated again related to the development of the matter of significant findings submitted by the Technical Team. However, according to M. Iqbal, the findings could not be revealed to the public, he reasoned because it was feared that it would actually complicate further efforts related to the disclosure of terror cases against Baswedan Novels.
"I also say there are very significant findings that have been obtained by the fact finding technical team," he explained.
According to Iqbal, the technical team works very closely in contrast to the open fact finding team. Technical team) we are conducting technical police, therefore we have not yet opened (the findings) to the public.
"We can just go back to zero. Insyaallah we will not reveal how long this case will be, the technical team is working to its full potential, second by second, it's just a matter of time just pray for the light," concluded M.Iqbal.
